references.paper_title: Riemannian flow matching on general geometries
references.reason: This paper introduces the core methodology of Riemannian Flow Matching (RFM), a crucial component of the proposed FlowLLM model, providing the mathematical framework for iteratively refining material representations.

references.paper_title: Fine-Tuned Language Models Generate Stable Inorganic Materials as Text
references.reason: This work is the most directly related prior work on leveraging LLMs for material generation, offering a baseline approach that FlowLLM improves upon and uses as a base distribution.

references.paper_title: FlowMM: Generating Materials with Riemannian Flow Matching
references.reason: This paper presents FlowMM, a related approach that uses RFM, establishing a comparative baseline for FlowLLM's performance and demonstrating the feasibility of combining LLMs and RFMs.

references.paper_title: Crystal Diffusion Variational Autoencoder for Periodic Material Generation
references.reason: This work introduces a strong baseline method (CD-VAE) against which FlowLLM is benchmarked, representing a state-of-the-art generative model for materials before the advent of LLMs in this area.

references.paper_title: The Materials Project: A materials genome approach to accelerating materials innovation
references.reason: This paper introduces the Materials Project dataset, the foundational dataset used for training and evaluating the FlowLLM model, providing the large-scale material data necessary for training and testing.
